articleContent.title: Chord: 11th in C (Shape: C)
articleContent.content:
## Chord: 11th in C (Shape: C)

The 11th chord in C, using the C major shape, includes the notes C, E, G, B, and F. In this chord, the F note on the 11th interval gives it a unique and rich sound that can add color and complexity to your chord progressions or compositions.

### Notes and Intervals Breakdown:
- C (Root)
- E (Major 3rd)
- G (Perfect 5th)
- B (Major 7th)
- F (11th)

### Genre and Musical Flavor:
The 11th chord in C is often used in jazz, R&B, and other contemporary genres where musicians look to explore more sophisticated harmony. It adds a dreamy and atmospheric quality to the music, creating tension and interest within the chord progression.

### Sample Songs:
1. **"Misty" by Erroll Garner**: This jazz standard prominently features 11th chords, including variations that add color and depth to the harmonic structure.
  
2. **"The Girl From Ipanema" by Ant√¥nio Carlos Jobim**: This bossa nova classic utilizes lush 11th chords to create a smooth and melodic accompaniment.
  
3. **"Georgia on My Mind" by Ray Charles**: This poignant ballad includes moments of 11th chords that enhance the emotional impact of the song.
